Description: Nine trees were felled in a Pinus thunbergii forest located in Ikunomatsubara, Kyushu University Forest.  Sample trees were treated with the stratified clip technique by cutting them into parts contained in horizontal layers of 0-0.2 m, 0.2-1.2 m, and at intervals of 1 m upward. Stem, branches, and needles were separated.
Measured fresh weight was converted to dry weight from the ratio of dry to fresh weights. Detailed method not reported.

M.I. Ishihara, H. Utsugi, H. Tanouchi, and T. Hiura conducted formal search of reference databases and digitized raw data from Yi et al. (1989). Based on this reference, meta data was also created by M.I. Ishihara. Species name and family names were converted by M.I. Ishihara according to the following references: Satake Y, Hara H (1989a) Wild flower of Japan Woody plants I (in Japanese). Heibonsha, Tokyo; Satake Y, Hara H (1989b) Wild flower of Japan Woody plants II (in Japanese). Heibonsha, Tokyo.
